results.title: Student Fatally Shot by Woman He Stopped to Help
results.abstract: Adam Simjee was with his girlfriend in a national forest in Alabama when a woman flagged them down, claiming she had car trouble.

media.caption: Adam Simjee and his girlfriend Mikayla Paulus. Mr. Simjee died in an exchange of gunfire last week after a woman pretending to be a stranded driver forced them into the woods.

results.byline: By Kenneth P. Vogel and Shane Goldmacher
results.title: An Unusual $1.6 Billion Donation Bolsters Conservatives
results.abstract: A low-profile Republican financier donated his company to a new group run by the influential operative Leonard A. Leo.

media.caption: Leonard A. Leo has used his connections to Republican donors and politicians to help finance battles over judicial appointments, abortion rights, voting rules and climate change policy.
media.copyright: T.J. Kirkpatrick for The New York Times

results.abstract: Dr. Anthony S. Fauci, who has advised seven presidents and spent more than half a century at the National Institutes of Health, will leave government service by the end of the year.

results.title: Trump Had More Than 300 Classified Documents at Mar-a-Lago
results.abstract: The National Archives found more than 150 sensitive documents when it got a first batch of material from the former president in January, helping to explain the Justice Department’s urgent response.

results.title: An Unidentified Illness Is Killing Dogs in Michigan, Officials Say
results.abstract: Veterinarians are not sure how contagious the malady is. Most of the dogs affected so far have been under the age of two, an official said.

media.caption: Smokey, a 10-month-old silver Labrador retriever, experienced symptoms that left him lethargic. Officials believe a strain of parvovirus could be to blame for an illness affecting dogs in Michigan.

media.caption: In his 2015 hit “Trap Queen,” Fetty Wap rapped that he was “in love with the money, I ain’t never lettin’ go.”

results.abstract: The actor, 78, was a featured guest at Monster-Mania Con in Cherry Hill, N.J. He was charged with two counts of criminal sexual contact, among other counts, the police said.

results.title: Home Appraised With a Black Owner: $472,000. With a White Owner: $750,000.
results.abstract: Nathan Connolly and his wife, Shani Mott, say an appraisal company undervalued their home based on their race. The couple has filed a lawsuit in Maryland.

media.caption: Nathan Connolly and Shani Mott are suing an appraiser and a mortgage lender after their Baltimore home was estimated to be worth $472,000. After the couple removed any indications that Black people lived there, a second appraiser valued the home at $750,000.
